DataElement.preferredName: Difficulty Walking And/Or Spasticity And/Or Spastic Gait Neurologic Function Scale Domain Clinical Score Assessment Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric value measured, assigned or computed related to the difficulty walking, spasticity, or spastic gait neurologic function scale domain.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Difficulty Walking And/Or Spasticity And/Or Spastic Gait Neurologic Function Scale Domain Clinical Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved._The act of traveling by foot._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Increased involuntary muscle tone caused by central nervous system disorders that affect the regions interfering with voluntary movement. It results in gait, movement, and speech disturbances. Representative examples of disorders causing spasticity include brain or spinal cord injury, and multiple sclerosis._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._A pattern of walking found in individuals with chronically-contracted leg muscles in which the affected leg or legs drag in a stiff, semicircular motion during ambulation. This may be seen in patients with cerebral palsy or multiple sclerosis._A specific area of neurological interest within the Raymond neurologic function scale, subdivided into 3 or 4 levels of function with scores based on discrete quantifiable measures._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Difficulty Walking And/Or Spasticity And/Or Spastic Gait Raymond Neurologic Function Scale Domain
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.:The act of traveling by foot.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:Increased involuntary muscle tone caused by central nervous system disorders that affect the regions interfering with voluntary movement. It results in gait, movement, and speech disturbances. Representative examples of disorders causing spasticity include brain or spinal cord injury, and multiple sclerosis.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:A pattern of walking found in individuals with chronically-contracted leg muscles in which the affected leg or legs drag in a stiff, semicircular motion during ambulation. This may be seen in patients with cerebral palsy or multiple sclerosis.:A specific area of neurological interest within the Raymond neurologic function scale, subdivided into 3 or 4 levels of function with scores based on discrete quantifiable measures.

Concepts.definition: Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.
The act of traveling by foot.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.

Increased involuntary muscle tone caused by central nervous system disorders that affect the regions interfering with voluntary movement. It results in gait, movement, and speech disturbances. Representative examples of disorders causing spasticity include brain or spinal cord injury, and multiple sclerosis.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.

A pattern of walking found in individuals with chronically-contracted leg muscles in which the affected leg or legs drag in a stiff, semicircular motion during ambulation. This may be seen in patients with cerebral palsy or multiple sclerosis.
A specific area of neurological interest within the Raymond neurologic function scale, subdivided into 3 or 4 levels of function with scores based on discrete quantifiable measures.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Neurologic Function Scale Assessment Score Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A 25-point scale used to evaluate the severity of gross neurologic dysfunction by scoring 15 disabilities across multiple domains._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: A 25-point scale used to evaluate the severity of gross neurologic dysfunction by scoring 15 disabilities across multiple domains.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
